intro: Gouania andamanica var. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman rocknettle, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. This species is often found growing in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the humid and tropical conditions of its native habitat.
